directions.dialogText: Let's start out by moving the \`'chicken'\` to the other side of the river. Type \`'chicken'\` between the \`()\` in the \`pickUp()\` function.

levels.mission: Type \`'chicken'\` between the \`()\` in the \`pickUp()\` function above.
levels.tools:
\`crossRiver()\` - Use the boat to cross to the other side of the river.

\`dropOff()\` - Drop off any items that are in the boat.

\`pickUp('item')\` - Pick up the specified item.
levels.tips: Use \`pickUp('chicken')\` to get the chicken into the boat.

directions.dialogText: Now add \`crossRiver()\` and \`dropOff('chicken')\` to your code to move the chicken to the other side of the river.

levels.mission: Below \`pickUp('chicken')\`, add \`crossRiver()\` then \`dropOff('chicken')\` to move the chicken to the other side of the river.
levels.tools:
\`crossRiver()\` - Use the boat to cross to the other side of the river.

\`dropOff()\` - Drop off any items that are in the boat.

\`pickUp('item')\` - Pick up the specified item.

directions.dialogText: This time, you have to write the functions yourself. Cross the river, pick up the \`'grain'\`, cross the river again, and drop off the \`'grain'\`.

levels.mission: This time, cross the river, pick up the \`'grain'\`, cross the river again, and drop off the \`'grain'\`.
levels.tools:
\`crossRiver()\` - Use the boat to cross to the other side of the river.

\`dropOff()\` - Drop off any items that are in the boat.

\`pickUp('item')\` - Pick up the specified item.

quiz.text: Which one of the following choices would call a \`putDown\` function?
Which code below will make the squirrel get the acorn?
Which of the following could NOT be a function name?
In \`jump(2);\`, which part is the parameter?

directions.dialogText: OK! We can't leave the chicken with the grain or she will eat it! Take the \`'chicken'\` back across the river and drop it off. Then pick up the \`'fox'\`, cross the river and drop it off.

levels.mission: Take the \`'chicken'\` back across the river and drop it off. Then pick up the \`'fox'\`, cross the river and drop it off.
levels.tools:
\`crossRiver()\` - Use the boat to cross to the other side of the river.

\`dropOff()\` - Drop off any items that are in the boat.

\`pickUp('item')\` - Pick up the specified item.
levels.tips: Type \`pickUp('chicken')\`, \`crossRiver()\`, and \`dropOff('chicken')\`, then repeat those steps again with the \`'fox'\`.

directions.dialogText: To finish, cross the river, pick up the \`'chicken'\`, cross the river again, then drop off the \`'chicken'\`.

levels.mission: Cross the river, pick up the \`'chicken'\`, cross the river again, then drop off the \`'chicken'\`.
levels.tools:
\`crossRiver()\` - Use the boat to cross to the other side of the river.

\`dropOff()\` - Drop off any items that are in the boat.

\`pickUp('item')\` - Pick up the specified item.
levels.tips: Type \`crossRiver()\`, \`pickUp('chicken')\`, \`crossRiver()\` and \`dropOff('chicken')\` to get the chicken into the boat.

directions.dialogText: Now try the whole thing from the beginning! Good luck!

levels.mission: A farmer needs to cross a river with a chicken, a fox and a bag of grain, but his boat can only hold him and one other object. If left together, the fox will eat the chicken and the chicken will eat the grain. Can you get the farmer across the river without losing any of them?
levels.tools:
\`crossRiver()\` - Use the boat to cross to the other side of the river.

\`dropOff()\` - Drop off any items that are in the boat.

\`pickUp('item')\` - Pick up the specified item.
